knowledge.title: Jewellery advice
knowledge.description: This system will help a customer decide what kind of jewellery the user can buy, based on their desires. It also provides the tools needed to create the piece themselves, if they have indicated that they are interested in knowing this.

goal.name: final
goal.answer: I recommend a complex earring made of glass with red elements. This can be defined as an earring that is an assembly of previously acquired, ready-made and hand-made parts. In this case, the earring stud will be ready-made and attached to a hand-made glass bead. The required parts are a presentational object, a simple ready-made ear-stud and an ear nut to secure the earring when worn. To assemble, you should attach (glue, set, solder) the presentational object to the ear-stud and add the ear-nut.

I recommend a custom complex earring made of glass with red elements. This can be defined as an earring which is completely customised, including the earring studs. In this case, the way the earring is attached to the ear can be an individual solution varying from a simple pin through the ear, a pressure clasp or hook. A hand-made glass bead or other glass object can then be attached. The required parts are a presentational object, a ready-made earring-mechanism (hook, stud or clasp) with or without safety-option. To assemble, attach the presentational object to the mechanism (glue, set, solder, with jump-ring), and attach safety-option if so desired.

I recommend a simple earring made of silver with red elements. This can be defined as an earring that is made of simple and pre-bought parts. An example of this would be a pre-bought earring stud attached to a simple glass bead or object. The required parts are a simple ready-made ear-stud and an ear-nut. To assemble, attach ear-nut to ear-stud (glue, set, solder).

I recommend a simple custom earring made of glass with red elements. This can be defined as an earring which is made out of simple custom hand-made parts. In this case, the attachement style of the earring to the ear can differ from studs to pressure clasps or hooks. A piece which does not require a complex process of techniques to create can then be attached. The required parts are a presentational object, a simple needle and an ear-nut to secure the earring when worn. To assemble, attach the presentational object to the needle (glue) and add the ear-nut.
